cards.name: Abbey Gargoyles
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"They don't move, do they?"
"Only for the wrong sort of people."
"Are we the wrong sort of people?"

cards.name: Abyssal Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"Mystic shadow, bending near me, /
Who art thou? / Whence come ye?"
—Stephen Crane,
"Mystic shadow, bending near me"

cards.name: Adarkar Wastes
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Æther Storm
cards.text:
Creature spells can't be cast.
Pay 4 life: Destroy Æther Storm. It can't be regenerated. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.flavor: Thunder in the wind / no rain / peace mourns its passing.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

cards.name: Akron Legionnaire
cards.text: Except for creatures named Akron Legionnaire and artifact creatures, creatures you control can't attack.

cards.name: Alabaster Potion
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains X life.
• Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor:
Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity.
—D'Avenant proverb

cards.name: Aladdin's Ring
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
". . . [T]he magician drew a ring off his finger . . . , saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'"
—The Arabian Nights,
Junior Classics trans.

cards.name: Ambush Party
cards.text: First strike, haste
cards.flavor:
"Fair fight? I'll take survival over chivalry any day!"
—Tor Wauki, Bandit King

cards.name: Amulet of Kroog
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing.

cards.name: An-Havva Constable
cards.text: An-Havva Constable's toughness is equal to 1 plus the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Joskun and the other constables serve with passion, if not with grace."
—Devin, faerie noble

cards.name: Angry Mob
cards.text:
Trample
As long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.

cards.name: Animate Dead
cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

cards.name: Animate Wall
cards.text:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor:
"When you have been bitten with fangs of granite, you start to long for the ivory sabers of tigers."
—Norin the Wary

cards.name: Ankh of Mishra
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.flavor: Tawnos finally cracked the puzzle: the strange structures did not house Mishra's malevolent creations but were themselves among his creations.

cards.name: Anti-Magic Aura
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be the target of spells and can't be enchanted by other Auras.

cards.name: Arenson's Aura
cards.text:
{W}, Sacrifice an enchantment: Destroy target enchantment.
{3}{U}{U}: Counter target enchantment spell.
cards.flavor:
"Cloak me in mystery, hide my names from my enemies, and let me draw from the well of power."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.

cards.name: Armor of Faith
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Keep your chain mail, warrior. I have my own form of protection."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

cards.name: Ashes to Ashes
cards.text: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"Kings and beggars, they end the same—
Surrounded by stench, rot, and blame."
—Aline Corralurn, "Legacy"

cards.name: Ashnod's Altar
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Add {2} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: The Brothers' War scarred the land, but Ashnod left her mark in the bloodlines of those she tortured.

cards.name: Ashnod's Transmogrant
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
cards.flavor: Ashnod found few willing to trade their humanity for the power she offered.

cards.name: Aspect of Wolf
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.

cards.name: Atog
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The bane of all artificers, the legendary atogs devoured intricate tools to further their own twisted growth.

cards.name: Aurochs
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.
cards.flavor: One auroch may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

cards.name: Aysen Bureaucrats
cards.text: {T}: Tap target creature with power 2 or less.
cards.flavor:
"When one's word is law, one's whim is equally binding."
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat

cards.name: Azure Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
Little dreamt could seem so cruel
As waiting for the wings outspread,
The jagged teeth, the burning eyes,
And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.

cards.name: Bad Moon
cards.text: Black creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Ball Lightning
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

cards.name: Barbed Sextant
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Barbed Sextant: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Barl's Cage
cards.text: {3}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: For a dozen years the cage had held Lord Ith, but as the Pretender Mairsil's power weakened, so did the bars.

cards.name: Battering Ram
cards.text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.)
Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.
cards.flavor: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.

cards.name: Benalish Hero
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the Hero.

cards.name: Binding Grasp
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Binding Grasp unless you pay {1}{U}.
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+1.
cards.flavor:
"What I want, I take."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran royal mage

cards.name: Bird Maiden
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"Four things that never meet do here unite To shed my blood and to ravage my heart,
A radiant brow and tresses that beguile
And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

cards.name: Blessed Wine
cards.text:
You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Out there, there are spirits, but here, there is wine."
—Blessing for the bounty of Kjeld

cards.name: Blight
cards.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

cards.name: Blinking Spirit
cards.text: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Don't look at it! Maybe it'll go away!"
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

cards.name: Blood Lust
cards.text: If target creature has toughness 5 or greater, it gets +4/-4 until end of turn. Otherwise, it gets +4/-X until end of turn, where X is its toughness minus 1.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the imp's muck-crusted claws.

cards.name: Bog Rats
cards.text: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.flavor: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave;
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

cards.name: Boomerang
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "O! call back yesterday, bid time return." —William Shakespeare, King Richard the Second

cards.name: Bottle of Suleiman
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

cards.name: Bottomless Vault
cards.text:
Bottomless Vault enters the battlefield tapped.
You may choose not to untap Bottomless Vault during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Bottomless Vault is tapped, put a storage counter on it.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Bottomless Vault: Add {B} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments, victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter
Kjeldoran royal mage

cards.name: Brainwash
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.
cards.flavor: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."

cards.name: Brassclaw Orcs
cards.text: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
cards.flavor:
"Modern Sarpadia's swarming with thrulls. It's a testament to the orcs that they've survived there so long."
—Elbieta, Argivian scholar

cards.name: Breeding Pit
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Breeding Pit unless you pay {B}{B}.
At the beginning of your end step, put a 0/1 black Thrull creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.

cards.name: Broken Visage
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact attacking creature. It can't be regenerated. Put a black Spirit creature token with that creature's power and toughness onto the battlefield. Sacrifice the token at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Brothers of Fire
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Fire is never a gentle master.

cards.name: Brushland
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Carapace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Now that's a fashion statement."
—Devin, faerie noble

cards.name: Caribou Range
cards.text:
Enchant land you control
Enchanted land has "{W}{W}, {T}: Put a 0/1 white Caribou creature token onto the battlefield."
Sacrifice a Caribou token: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Carrion Ants
cards.text: {1}: Carrion Ants gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "War is no picnic," my father liked to say. But the ants seemed to disagree.

cards.name: Castle
cards.text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.flavor:
"Hang out our banners on the outward walls; / The cry is still, ‘They come'; our castle's strength / Will laugh a siege to scorn."
—William Shakespeare, Macbeth

cards.name: Cat Warriors
cards.text: Forestwalk
cards.flavor: These stealthy felines have survived so many battles that some believe they must possess many lives.

cards.name: Cave People
cards.text:
Whenever Cave People attacks, it gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: Chub Toad
cards.text: Whenever Chub Toad blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Chub toad, chub toad
At the door.
Run away quick
Or you'll run no more.
—Traditional children's rhyme

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
cards.text: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green
cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Red
cards.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: White
cards.text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Clay Statue
cards.text: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.
cards.flavor: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

cards.name: Cloak of Confusion
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
Whenever enchanted creature attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it assign no combat damage this turn. If you do, defending player discards a card at random.

cards.name: Clockwork Beast
cards.text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Clockwork Steed
cards.text:
Clockwork Steed enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Steed can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Steed attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Cockatrice
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Colossus of Sardia
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor: From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom: / Warrior born from a rocky womb.

cards.name: Conquer
cards.text:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.
cards.flavor:
"Every field watered in warriors' blood is sacred ground. Lay it not to waste, but claim it for our own—for glory, and for Stromgald!"
—Avram Garrisson,
Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

cards.name: Coral Helm
cards.text: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Craw Giant
cards.text:
Trample
Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
cards.flavor: Harthag gave a jolly laugh as he surveyed the army before him. "Ho ho ho! Midgets! You think you can stand in my way?"

cards.name: Craw Wurm
cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

cards.name: Crimson Manticore
cards.text:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Manticores divide all beings into two categories: other manticores and dinner.

cards.name: Crown of the Ages
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Attach target Aura attached to a creature to another creature.

cards.name: Crumble
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"Ashes and dust; dust and ashes.
Hope it works before it smashes."
—Argivian children's rhyme

cards.name: Crusade
cards.text: White creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Cursed Land
cards.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: D'Avenant Archer
cards.text: {T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Avenant's archers are also trained as poets, so that each arrow is guided by a fragment of verse.

cards.name: Dance of Many
cards.text:
When Dance of Many enters the battlefield, put a token that's a copy of target nontoken creature onto the battlefield.
When Dance of Many leaves the battlefield, exile the token.
When the token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Dance of Many.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Dance of Many unless you pay {U}{U}.

cards.name: Dancing Scimitar
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.

cards.name: Dandân
cards.text:
Dandân can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Dandân.
cards.flavor:
"Catch good today. Start replacing crew tomorrow."
—Faysal al-Mousa, fisher captain, log

cards.name: Dark Maze
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.  Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"Stray not onto the path of darkness, or be lost forever."
—Baki, wizard attendant

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Death Speakers
cards.text: Protection from black
cards.flavor:
"The dead may be beyond the law, but speaking the wisdom of the dead will afford no protection!"
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat

cards.name: Death Ward
cards.text: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Deathgrip
cards.text: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.
cards.flavor:
"Every forest is carpeted with the corpses of a thousand trees."
—Baron Sengir to Autumn Willow

cards.name: Deflection
cards.text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
cards.flavor:
Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

cards.name: Derelor
cards.text: Black spells you cast cost {B} more to cast.
cards.flavor:
"The derelor's greatest contribution to the Ebon Hand was the inspirational effect its creator's execution had upon the other thrull breeders."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

cards.name: Desert Twister
cards.text: Destroy target permanent.

cards.name: Detonate
cards.text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

cards.name: Diabolic Machine
cards.text: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.
cards.flavor:
"The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."
—Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Disintegrate
cards.text: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Divine Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: These tears of pain I weep to the skies, Not bitter drops, but water made divine. Each gem of sorrow slips, no longer mine, But proffered thus to echo other cries.

cards.name: Divine Transformation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
cards.flavor: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.

cards.name: Dragon Engine
cards.text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"How is it the legged engines seem so much more alive than their wheeled counterparts? Simply, they were born, not made."
—Mishra

cards.name: Drain Life
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.

cards.name: Drain Power
cards.text: Target player activates a mana ability of each land he or she controls. Then put all mana from that player's mana pool into yours.

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral,
Necromancer's Handbook

cards.name: Durkwood Boars
cards.flavor:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—The Bible, Mark 5:13

cards.name: Dust to Dust
cards.text: Exile two target artifacts.
cards.flavor:
"All this nonsense made by mages
Rusts and crumbles through the ages."
—Aline Corralurn, "Inheritance"

cards.name: Dwarven Catapult
cards.text: Dwarven Catapult deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among all creatures target opponent controls.
cards.flavor:
"Often greatly outnumbered in battle, dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

cards.name: Dwarven Hold
cards.text:
Dwarven Hold enters the battlefield tapped.
You may choose not to untap Dwarven Hold during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Dwarven Hold is tapped, put a storage counter on it.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Dwarven Hold: Add {R} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.name: Dwarven Ruins
cards.text:
Dwarven Ruins enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Dwarven Ruins: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Dwarven Soldier
cards.text: Whenever Dwarven Soldier blocks or becomes blocked by one or more Orcs, Dwarven Soldier gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Orc must die / Orc must die / Not an orc? / March on by."
—Dwarven marching song

cards.name: Dwarven Warriors
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.name: Ebon Stronghold
cards.text:
Ebon Stronghold enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ebon Stronghold: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Elder Druid
cards.text: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor:
"Did clouds dance in his eyes,
did thorns play at his fingertips?"
—Shesul Fass, faerie band

cards.name: Elkin Bottle
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Exile the top card of your library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card.

cards.name: Elven Riders
cards.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm.
—Elven proverb

cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

cards.name: Energy Flux
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."
cards.flavor:
"Nothing endures but change."
—Heraclitus

cards.name: Enervate
cards.text:
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran royal mage

cards.name: Erg Raiders
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

cards.name: Errantry
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and can only attack alone.
cards.flavor:
"There is no shame in solitude. The lone knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

cards.name: Eternal Warrior
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance.
cards.flavor: Warriors of the Tsunami-nito School spend years in training to master the way of effortless effort.

cards.name: Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore
cards.text:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.
Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore can't be blocked except by Walls.
cards.flavor: The highway of fear is the shortest route to defeat.

cards.name: Evil Presence
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.

cards.name: Eye for an Eye
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

cards.name: Fallen Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Angels are simply extensions of truth upon the fabric of life—and there is far more dark than light."
—Baron Sengir

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Feedback
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Feldon's Cane
cards.text: {T}, Exile Feldon's Cane: Shuffle your graveyard into your library.
cards.flavor: Feldon found the first of these canes frozen in the Ronom Glacier.

cards.name: Fellwar Stone
cards.text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
cards.flavor:
Throw stones, and throw away the world.
—Dwarven proverb

cards.name: Feroz's Ban
cards.text: Creature spells cost {2} more to cast.
cards.flavor:
"Without the protection of Feroz's Ban, I fear the Homelands are lost."
—Daria

cards.name: Fire Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Fire Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: Brimstone marks this drake's territory. Unfortunately for travelers, all of the Burning Isles smell likewise.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"And topples round the dreary west
A looming bastion fringed with fire."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson,
"In Memoriam"

cards.name: Flame Spirit
cards.text: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian chieftain

cards.name: Flare
cards.text:
Flare deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor: The secret of destruction is simple: everything burns.

cards.name: Flashfires
cards.text: Destroy all Plains.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.name: Flood
cards.text: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.
cards.flavor:
"A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield."
—Vibekke Ragnild, Witches and War

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.
cards.flavor:
"It blinked, and flower petals fell like tears. Harthar, sensing weakness, attacked—and his blood fell like petals."
—Shesul Fass, faerie bard

cards.name: Force Spike
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor:
"Unknown spears / Suddenly hurtle before my dream-awakened eyes . . . ."
—William Butler Yeats,
"The Valley of the Black Pig"

cards.name: Forget
cards.text: Target player discards two cards, then draws as many cards as he or she discarded this way.

cards.name: Fountain of Youth
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: The fountain had stood in the town square for centuries, but only the pigeons knew its secret.

cards.name: Foxfire
cards.text:
Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Only the foolish fear foxfire."
—Kolbjörn,
Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

cards.name: Frozen Shade
cards.text: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"There are some qualities, some incorporate things, / That have a double life, which thus is made / A type of twin entity which springs / From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

cards.name: Funeral March
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor:
"Turn the key deftly in the oiled wards,
And seal the hushed casket of my soul."
—John Keats, "To Sleep"

cards.name: Fungusaur
cards.text: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

cards.name: Fyndhorn Elder
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Do we know what we're doing? Yes—the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

cards.name: Game of Chaos
cards.text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 1 life and target opponent loses 1 life, and you decide whether to flip again. If you lose the flip, you lose 1 life and that opponent gains 1 life, and that player decides whether to flip again. Double the life stakes with each flip.

cards.name: Gaseous Form
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
". . . [A]nd gives to airy nothing
A local habitation and a name."
—William Shakespeare, A Midsummer-Night's Dream

cards.name: Gauntlets of Chaos
cards.text: {5}, Sacrifice Gauntlets of Chaos: Exchange control of target artifact, creature, or land you control and target permanent an opponent controls that shares one of those types with it. If those permanents are exchanged this way, destroy all Auras attached to them.

cards.name: Ghazbán Ogre
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.
cards.flavor:
"We were holding our own—until the ogre guiding us suddenly grinned and turned on our commander."
—Ivra Jursdotter, Sarpadian mercenary

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: While it possesses potent venom, the giant spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

cards.name: Giant Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
cards.flavor:
"O! it is excellent / To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous / To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare,
Measure for Measure

cards.name: Glacial Wall
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor:
"As we neared, Belfar proclaimed the wall to be made of glass and went forward to prove it. We had no choice but to pull his hands free from where he had touched it, leaving flesh palmprints on the icy wall."
—Tross, Vainus Expedition leader

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
cards.flavor:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!"
"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

cards.name: Goblin Hero
cards.flavor:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back!"
—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok . . . .

cards.name: Goblin War Drums
cards.text: Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
cards.flavor:
"Goblins charge with a deafening war cry. The cry doesn't mean anything—it just drowns out the drums!"
—Reod Dai, mercenary

cards.name: Goblin Warrens
cards.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

cards.name: Grapeshot Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: Recent research suggests these creatures were invented by Urza's and Mishra's original master, Tocasia, and that both brothers used them.

cards.name: Greater Realm of Preservation
cards.text: {1}{W}: The next time a black or red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Greater Werewolf
cards.text: At end of combat, put a -0/-2 counter on each creature blocking or blocked by Greater Werewolf.
cards.flavor:
"Two legs by day, four legs by night, eyes raging in storm-gotten might."
—Ancient Northland riddle

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Havenwood Battleground
cards.text:
Havenwood Battleground enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Havenwood Battleground: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Heal
cards.text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Hecatomb
cards.text:
When Hecatomb enters the battlefield, sacrifice Hecatomb unless you sacrifice four creatures.
Tap an untapped Swamp you control: Hecatomb deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Helm of Chatzuk
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Whether inspired by fear or by honor, all loyalty lends might.

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

cards.name: Hipparion
cards.text: Hipparion can't block creatures with power 3 or greater unless you pay {1}.
cards.flavor:
"Someone once said that hipparions are to warriors what aesthir are to skyknights. Don't believe it."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Hollow Trees
cards.text:
Hollow Trees enters the battlefield tapped.
You may choose not to untap Hollow Trees during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Hollow Trees is tapped, put a storage counter on it.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Hollow Trees: Add {G} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Homarid Warrior
cards.text: {U}: Homarid Warrior gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Homarid Warrior. (A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

cards.name: Hungry Mist
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
cards.flavor:
"All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."
—Gemma, Willow priestess

cards.name: Hurkyl's Recall
cards.text: Return all artifacts target player owns to his or her hand.
cards.flavor: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife and former student, Hurkyl.

cards.name: Hurloon Minotaur
cards.flavor: The minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
"The raging winds . . . , settling on the sea, the surges sweep, / Raise liquid mountains, and disclose the deep."
—Virgil, Aeneid, Book I, trans. Dryden

cards.name: Hydroblast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's red.
• Destroy target permanent if it's red.
cards.flavor:
"Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran royal mage

cards.name: Icatian Phalanx
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Even after the wall was breached in half a dozen places, the phalanxes fought on, standing solidly against the onrushing raiders. Disciplined and dedicated, they held their ranks to the end, even in the face of tremendous losses.

cards.name: Icatian Scout
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"In these, our final days, I offer this. Though we could not save Icatia, we gave our children time to grow, and love, before it fell."
—Ailis Connaut, diary

cards.name: Icatian Store
cards.text:
Icatian Store enters the battlefield tapped.
You may choose not to untap Icatian Store during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Icatian Store is tapped, put a storage counter on it.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Icatian Store: Add {W} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.name: Icatian Town
cards.text: Put four 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Icatia's once-peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from orcs and goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

cards.name: Ice Floe
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Ice Floe during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature without flying that's attacking you. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Ice Floe remains tapped.

cards.name: Imposing Visage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
cards.flavor: With the horrible mask, Lagfrak the Low terrorized the countryside. But then he met Il-Chunt, the mask's model . . . .

cards.name: Incinerate
cards.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Yes, I think ‘toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

cards.name: Inferno
cards.text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

cards.name: Infinite Hourglass
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Infinite Hourglass.
All creatures get +1/+0 for each time counter on Infinite Hourglass.
{3}: Remove a time counter from Infinite Hourglass. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

cards.name: Initiates of the Ebon Hand
cards.text: {1}: Add {B} to your mana pool. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Initiates of the Ebon Hand at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"We are no longer Nature's children, but her masters . . . ."
—Oath of the Ebon Hand

cards.name: Instill Energy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Ironclaw Curse
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -0/-1.
Enchanted creature can't block creatures with power equal to or greater than the enchanted creature's toughness.

cards.name: Ironclaw Orcs
cards.text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
cards.flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan.

cards.name: Ironroot Treefolk
cards.flavor:
"‘I'll show you how to handle the treefolk!' the giant bragged, and he strode off into the forest. Two days later he returned, his face masked in sap and a nest behind his ear. None dared ask who won."
—Azeworai, "The Treeling"

cards.name: Island Sanctuary
cards.text: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Ivory Guardians
cards.text:
Protection from red
Creatures named Ivory Guardians get +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls a nontoken red permanent.
cards.flavor:
"But who is to guard the guards themselves?"
—Juvenal, Satires

cards.name: Jade Monolith
cards.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

cards.name: Jalum Tome
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: This timeworn relic was responsible for many of Urza's victories, though he never fully comprehended its mystic runes.

cards.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
cards.flavor: Each day of their journey, Jandor opened the saddlebags and found them full of mutton, quinces, cheese, date rolls, wine, and all manner of delicious and satisfying foods.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Jester's Cap
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Cap: Search target player's library for three cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
cards.flavor:
"Know your foes' strengths as well as their weaknesses."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

cards.name: Johtull Wurm
cards.text: Whenever Johtull Wurm becomes blocked, it gets -2/-1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.
cards.flavor:
"To bring her down we must be on all sides at once—leave one avenue open and we'll all be dead."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

cards.name: Jokulhaups
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

cards.name: Joven's Tools
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn except by Walls.
cards.flavor:
"If that thief Joven ever shows his head around here again, make sure he leaves without it."
—Eron the Relentless

cards.name: Justice
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Justice unless you pay {W}{W}.
Whenever a red creature or spell deals damage, Justice deals that much damage to that creature's or spell's controller.

cards.name: Juxtapose
cards.text: You and target player exchange control of the creature you each control with the highest converted mana cost. Then exchange control of artifacts the same way. If two or more permanents a player controls are tied for highest cost, their controller chooses one of them.

cards.name: Karma
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps he or she controls.

cards.name: Karplusan Forest
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Keldon Warlord
cards.text: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.
cards.flavor: What if they threw a war, and everybody came?

cards.name: Killer Bees
cards.text:
Flying
{G}: Killer Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.

cards.name: Kismet
cards.text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

cards.name: Kjeldoran Dead
cards.text:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.
cards.flavor:
"They shall drink sorrow's dregs. They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
cards.text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
cards.flavor:
Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard

cards.name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
cards.text: Flying; first strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: The heartlink between soldier and steed is hatched with the aesthir struggling from its shell.

cards.name: Knight of Stromgald
cards.text:
Protection from white
{B}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Knight of Stromgald gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Kjeldorans should rule supreme, and to the rest, death!"
—Avram Garrisson,
Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

cards.name: Krovikan Fetish
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Krovikan Fetish enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Some Krovikans find strength in the ears and eyes of their victims and wear such fetishes into battle.

cards.name: Krovikan Sorcerer
cards.text:
{T}, Discard a nonblack card: Draw a card.
{T}, Discard a black card: Draw two cards, then discard one of them.

cards.name: Labyrinth Minotaur
cards.text: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"I doubt any labyrinth minotaurs still live—but then we minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba shaman

cards.name: Leshrac's Rite
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk.
cards.flavor:
"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Leviathan
cards.text:
Trample
Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.
Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

cards.name: Ley Druid
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: After years of training, the druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

cards.name: Lhurgoyf
cards.text: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
cards.flavor:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

cards.name: Library of Leng
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.

cards.name: Lifeforce
cards.text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.
cards.flavor:
"Every fallen tree nourishes a thousand seedlings."
—Autumn Willow to Baron Sengir

cards.name: Lifetap
cards.text: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Keep a green tree in your heart and perhaps the singing bird will come."
—Chinese proverb

cards.name: Living Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Living Lands
cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
cards.flavor:
"‘We have no legs,' the warrior spat, ‘for we have finished running.'"
—Vodalian folktale

cards.name: Lord of the Pit
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

cards.name: Lost Soul
cards.text: Swampwalk
cards.flavor: Her hand gently beckons, she whispers your name—but those who go with her are never the same.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor:
"When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait."
—Geyadrone Dihada

cards.name: Magical Hack
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.name: Magus of the Unseen
cards.text: {1}{U}, {T}: Untap target artifact an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the artifact, tap it.

cards.name: Mana Clash
cards.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

cards.name: Mana Flare
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

cards.name: Mana Vault
cards.text:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Manabarbs
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Marsh Viper
cards.text: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
cards.flavor:
"And the seraphs sob at vermin fangs
In human gore imbued."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Conqueror Wurm"

cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor: When the mighty sleep, the lowly prowl.

cards.name: Memory Lapse
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Most human scholars believe that merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

cards.name: Mesa Falcon
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

cards.name: Mesa Pegasus
cards.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the mesa pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a mesa pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

cards.name: Mind Bomb
cards.text: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards he or she discarded this way.

cards.name: Mind Ravel
cards.text:
Target player discards a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor: An end to reason, an end to order. Forget all that has been.

cards.name: Mind Warp
cards.text: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.
cards.flavor: The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.

cards.name: Mindstab Thrull
cards.text: Whenever Mindstab Thrull attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, defending player discards three cards.

cards.name: Mole Worms
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Mole Worms during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target land. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Mole Worms remains tapped.

cards.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
cards.flavor: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

cards.name: Mountain Goat
cards.text: Mountainwalk
cards.flavor:
"Folklore has it that to capture a mountain goat is a sign of divine blessing. I just know it's a sign that dinner is on the way."
—Klazina Jansdotter,
Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

cards.name: Murk Dwellers
cards.text: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.
cards.flavor: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

cards.name: Nature's Lore
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"It is in our nature to recognize beauty, but to repeat it—ah, that is another feat altogether."
—Hannah of Verdura

cards.name: Necrite
cards.text: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Necrites killed Jherana Rure, ending the counterinsurgency.

cards.name: Necropotence
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

cards.name: Nether Shadow
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Shadow is in your graveyard with three or more creature cards above it, you may put Nether Shadow onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
cards.text:
Nevinyrral's Disk enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

cards.name: Obelisk of Undoing
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Return target permanent you both own and control to your hand.
cards.flavor: The Battle of Tomakul taught Urza not to rely on fickle reinforcements.

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

cards.name: Orcish Captain
cards.text: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target Orc creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. If you lose the flip, it gets -0/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: There's a chance to win every battle.

cards.name: Orcish Conscripts
cards.text:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.

cards.name: Orcish Farmer
cards.text: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: There is no natural disaster quite like orcish farming.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Orcish Squatters
cards.text: Whenever Orcish Squatters attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target land defending player controls for as long as you control Orcish Squatters. If you do, Orcish Squatters assigns no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Order of the Sacred Torch
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.
cards.flavor: A blazing light to drive out the shadows.

cards.name: Order of the White Shield
cards.text:
Protection from black
{W}: Order of the White Shield gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Order of the White Shield gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A shield of light admits no shadow.

cards.name: Orgg
cards.text:
Trample
Orgg can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.
Orgg can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.flavor: It's bigger than it thinks.

cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor:
"It has been my honor to improve on Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."
—Urza, in his apprenticeship

cards.name: Panic
cards.text:
Cast Panic only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Paralyze
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If he or she does, untap the creature.

cards.name: Pearled Unicorn
cards.flavor:
"‘Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' ‘Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, ‘if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'"
—Lewis Carroll, Through the Looking-Glass

cards.name: Pentagram of the Ages
cards.text: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor: A mirror, a shield, a promise, a great distance, and a kind word—five ways to avoid harm.

cards.name: Personal Incarnation
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she owns Personal Incarnation.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half his or her life, rounded up.

cards.name: Pestilence
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Phantasmal Forces
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

cards.name: Phantom Monster
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe,
"The Haunted Palace"

cards.name: Pikemen
cards.text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. ‘Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said."
—Maeveen O'Donagh,
Memoirs of a Soldier

cards.name: Pirate Ship
cards.text:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.

cards.name: Pit Scorpion
cards.text: Whenever Pit Scorpion deals damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
cards.flavor: Sometimes the smallest nuisance can be the greatest pain.

cards.name: Plague Rats
cards.text: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Should you a Rat to madness tease
Why ev'n a Rat may plague you . . . ."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

cards.name: Portent
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle his or her library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Pox
cards.text: Each player loses a third of his or her life, then discards a third of the cards in his or her hand, then sacrifices a third of the creatures he or she controls, then sacrifices a third of the lands he or she controls. Round up each time.

cards.name: Pradesh Gypsies
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"A mysterious people indeed. Their origins are as secret as their traditions."
—Lord Magnus of Llanowar

cards.name: Primal Clay
cards.text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

cards.name: Primal Order
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Primal Order deals damage to that player equal to the number of nonbasic lands he or she controls.
cards.flavor:
"My sorrow: to dream of simple times, and wake in mine . . . ."
—Ola DaRiol, "Regrets"

cards.name: Primordial Ooze
cards.text:
Primordial Ooze attacks each turn if able.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Primordial Ooze. Then you may pay {X}, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters on it. If you don't, tap Primordial Ooze and it deals X damage to you.

cards.name: Prismatic Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Prismatic Ward enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by sources of the chosen color.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Occasionally members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

cards.name: Psychic Venom
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Pyroblast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's blue.
• Destroy target permanent if it's blue.
cards.flavor:
"Just the thing for those pesky water mages."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
cards.flavor:
"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant

cards.name: Rabid Wombat
cards.text:
Vigilance
Rabid Wombat gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.

cards.name: Radjan Spirit
cards.text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Crawing, crawing,
For my crowse crawing,
I lost the best feather i' my wing
For my crowse crawing."
—Anonymous Scottish ballad

cards.name: Rag Man
cards.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Ray of Command
cards.text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.

cards.name: Recall
cards.text: Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.

cards.name: Reef Pirates
cards.text: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: Relentless as the tides, souls dark as a moonless night. Bloodshed on their minds, and greed burning in their hearts like molten gold.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor: Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then fell lifeless to the ground.

cards.name: Repentant Blacksmith
cards.text: Protection from red
cards.flavor:
"For my confession they burned me with fire / And found that I was for endurance made."
—The Arabian Nights,
trans. Haddawy

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I too shall be brought low by death, but until then let me win glory."
—Homer, Iliad, Book XVIII

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Ruins of Trokair
cards.text:
Ruins of Trokair enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ruins of Trokair: Add {W}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Sabretooth Tiger
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor:
"I fear anything with teeth measured in handspans!"
—Norin the Wary

cards.name: Sacred Boon
cards.text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
cards.flavor:
"Divine gifts are granted to those who are worthy."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

cards.name: Sand Silos
cards.text:
Sand Silos enters the battlefield tapped.
You may choose not to untap Sand Silos during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Sand Silos is tapped, put a storage counter on it.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Sand Silos: Add {U} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.name: Scaled Wurm
cards.flavor:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these
wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor Spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Stoop, pick, turn, toss.
This is the way we mourn our loss."
—Scavenger dirge

cards.name: Scryb Sprites
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

cards.name: Sea Serpent
cards.text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

cards.name: Sea Spirit
cards.text: {U}: Sea Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It rose above our heads, above the ship, and still higher yet. No foggy, ice-laden sea in the world could frighten me more."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Sea Sprite
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"No one can catch what won't be caught."
—Kakra, sea troll

cards.name: Seasinger
cards.text:
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Seasinger.
You may choose not to untap Seasinger during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature whose controller controls an Island for as long as you control Seasinger and Seasinger remains tapped.

cards.name: Segovian Leviathan
cards.text: Islandwalk
cards.flavor: "Leviathan, too! Can you catch him with a fish-hook or run a line round his tongue?" —The Bible, Job 41:1

cards.name: Sengir Autocrat
cards.text:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, put three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens onto the battlefield.
When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.
cards.flavor:
"Evil is relative. Do sheep think any better of the shepherd?"
—Baron Sengir

cards.name: Seraph
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Seraph this turn dies, put that card onto the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step. Sacrifice the creature when you lose control of Seraph.

cards.name: Serpent Generator
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Snake artifact creature token onto the battlefield. It has "Whenever this creature deals damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter." (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

cards.name: Serra Bestiary
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Serra Bestiary unless you pay {W}{W}.
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.

cards.name: Serra Paladin
cards.text:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
{1}{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
One light, one blade, one purpose.
—Vow of the Serra Paladins

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk
cards.flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

cards.name: Shapeshifter
cards.text:
As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7.
Shapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Shatterstorm
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.

cards.name: Shield Bearer
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

cards.name: Shield Wall
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The strongest walls are made not of stone or steel but of the focused strength of warriors.

cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
