cards.flavor: While it's true most dragons are cruel, the Shivan dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

cards.name: Shrink
cards.text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"May you decrease like coal upon the hearth . . . Evaporate like water in a pail, Become as little as a linseed-grain . . . And so diminish that you come to nothing."
—Anglo-Saxon curse

cards.name: Sibilant Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.
cards.flavor: She had expected death to roar, to thunder, to growl. She did not recognize it when it came hissing to her side.

cards.name: Skull Catapult
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"Let any who doubt the evil of using the ancient devices look at this infernal machine. What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic device?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

cards.name: Sleight of Mind
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.name: Smoke
cards.text: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.

cards.name: Sorceress Queen
cards.text: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We have always counted time with sand; this pinch is your meaningless life."
—Nailah, self-proclaimed Queen of Rabiah

cards.name: Soul Barrier
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Soul Barrier deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she pays {2}.
cards.flavor:
"The Soul selects her own Society—
Then—shuts the Door—"
—Emily Dickinson,
"The Soul selects her own Society"

cards.name: Soul Net
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor:
"I regret feeding Kaervek's hunger for power—far better to live with animals innocent of such ambitions."
—Jolrael

cards.name: Stampede
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"When are beasts like a river?"
—The One Thousand Questions

cards.name: Stasis
cards.text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

cards.name: Steal Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

cards.name: Stone Giant
cards.text: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Stone Spirit
cards.text: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian chieftain

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Stromgald Cabal
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.
cards.flavor: When the alliance between Balduvia and Kjeldor deprived Stromgald of easy victories, its agents were forced to fuel their rituals with their own flesh.

cards.name: Sulfurous Springs
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Sulfurous Springs deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Svyelunite Temple
cards.text:
Svyelunite Temple enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Svyelunite Temple: Add {U}{U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Sylvan Library
cards.text: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw two additional cards. If you do, choose two cards in your hand drawn this turn. For each of those cards, pay 4 life or put the card on top of your library.

cards.name: Tarpan
cards.text: When Tarpan dies, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"A good tarpan will serve you, faithful and true. A bad one will kick you in the head."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Tawnos's Weaponry
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.
cards.flavor: When war machines became too costly, Tawnos's weaponry replaced them.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: The Brute
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: After years of being bullied, Fergo reaped the benefits of his newfound strength: he never met a man he didn't want to fight.

cards.name: The Hive
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp onto the battlefield. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Mouths and wings beyond numbering, but a single mind to guide them.

cards.name: The Wretched
cards.text: At end of combat, gain control of all creatures blocking The Wretched for as long as you control The Wretched.
cards.flavor:
Once I had the strength but no wisdom; now I have the wisdom but no strength.
—Persian proverb

cards.name: Thicket Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the basilisk's terrible power.

cards.name: Throne of Bone
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Thrull Retainer
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice Thrull Retainer: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Until the Rebellion, thrulls served their masters faithfully—even at the cost of their own lives."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

cards.name: Time Bomb
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Time Bomb.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Time Bomb: Time Bomb deals damage equal to the number of time counters on it to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Time Elemental
cards.text:
When Time Elemental attacks or blocks, at end of combat, sacrifice it and it deals 5 damage to you.
{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent that isn't enchanted to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Titania's Song
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

cards.name: Torture
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"It helps pass the time until you die."
—Grandmother Sengir

cards.name: Touch of Death
cards.text:
Touch of Death deals 1 damage to target player. You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"What was yours is mine. Your land, your people, and now your life."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Truce
cards.text: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two a player draws this way, that player gains 2 life.
cards.flavor:
Not all victories require defeat.
—Onean idiom

cards.name: Tsunami
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.

cards.name: Tundra Wolves
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.

cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Underground River
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Underground River deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

cards.name: Unstable Mutation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Updraft
cards.text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Come one, come all! this rock shall fly From its firm base as soon as I."
—Sir Walter Scott, "The Lady of the Lake"

cards.name: Urza's Avenger
cards.text: {0}: Urza's Avenger gets -1/-1 and gains your choice of banding, flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.

cards.name: Urza's Bauble
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Urza's Bauble: Look at a card at random in target player's hand. You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Urza's Mine
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

cards.name: Urza's Power Plant
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Artifact construction required immense resources.

cards.name: Urza's Tower
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Urza always put Tocasia's lessons on resource-gathering to effective use.

cards.name: Vampire Bats
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
cards.flavor:
"For something is amiss or out of place / When mice with wings can wear a human face."
—Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"

cards.name: Venom
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"I told him it was just a flesh wound, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."
—Maeveen O'Donagh,
Memoirs of a Soldier

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Weave the magic so that it sings to you, and will always fly home . . . ."
—Verduran teaching

cards.name: Vodalian Soldiers
cards.flavor:
"Vodalian rank is displayed by the colors and patterns of their skin. Beware the color red; that is the badge of the empress's favor."
—Corbio, pearl diver

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism

cards.name: Wall of Bone
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"Good neighbors make good walls."
—Jakkarak the Maimer

cards.name: Wall of Brambles
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
cards.flavor:
Sleeping in brambles
—Elven phrase meaning
"plagued by guilt"

cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Struggle, and you will only fan the flames."
—Talibah, embermage

cards.name: Wall of Spears
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
cards.flavor: Even the most conservative generals revised their tactics after the Battle of Sarinth, during which a handful of peasant-pikemen held off a trio of rampaging craw wurms.

cards.name: Wall of Stone
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: The ground itself lends its strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."

cards.name: Wanderlust
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"How terrible to wander wishing only to escape oneself."
—Taysir

cards.name: War Mammoth
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: I didn't think mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

cards.name: Warp Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

cards.name: Whirling Dervish
cards.text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.name: Wind Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Wind Spirit can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
cards.flavor:
" . . . When the trees bow down their heads, / The wind is passing by."
—Christina Rossetti,
"Who Has Seen the Wind?"

cards.name: Winds of Change
cards.text: Each player shuffles the cards from his or her hand into his or her library, then draws that many cards.
cards.flavor:
"'Tis the set of sails, and not the gales, Which tell us the way to go."
—Ella Wheeler Wilcox, "Winds of Fate"

cards.name: Winter Blast
cards.text: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, King Lear

cards.name: Winter Orb
cards.text: Players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"When once winter has ahold,
Not willingly does she withdraw
her icy touch, wistfully caressing—
The deepened air sleeps its cold."
—Aline Corralurn, "Late Thaw"

cards.name: Wolverine Pack
cards.text: Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
cards.flavor:
"Give them great meals of beef and iron and steel, they will eat like wolves and fight like devils."
—William Shakespeare, King Henry V

cards.name: Wooden Sphere
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Word of Blasting
cards.text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's converted mana cost to the Wall's controller.
cards.flavor:
"Walls? What walls?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Wyluli Wolf
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"When one wolf calls, others follow.
Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"
—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary

cards.name: Xenic Poltergeist
cards.text: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Zephyr Falcon
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Although greatly prized among falconers, the zephyr falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.

cards.name: Zombie Master
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk.
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.flavor: He controlled the zombies even before his own death; now nothing can make them betray him.

cards.name: Zur's Weirding
cards.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.
